WELCOME

Dear Guest,

     Welcome to our Inn. We hope you will have a wonderful stay with us, and that you may enjoy all that Newport has to offer.  

     Your room is furnished with many extras, such as hairdryers, iron, ironing boards, a selection of bathroom amenities, comfortable robes to lounge around in, personal Keurig coffee makers, and much more. But if there is anything else you need, please ask. 

     We would be more than willing to assist you in making plans for sightseeing excursions, sailing trips or dinner reservations. There is a lot to do and see in the Newport Area -Let us be your guides to a great vacation. 

     We have provided you with a room and front door key. Please take good care of these keys and return them to the innkeeper upon checkout. We will need to charge $50 for any unreturned keys. 

Enjoy your stay at the Almondy!  

Laurence & John

Innkeepers

    • Local Attractions & Activites 

    Newport has been a thriving Colonial Seaport since the early 1700's and known as America's First Resort and "City-by-the-sea". It offers something for everyone.

    • Enjoy our beautiful beaches. Beach parking is available (at a cost) at all Newport and Middletown area beaches. Only a short drive from our Inn. Beach - Guide 

    • Take a sailing or boat trip on Narragansett Bay and see why Rhode Island is called the Ocean State. Tour tickets are sold on Bannister's Wharf. Boat Tour 

    • Tour the various famous Newport Mansions to experience the Summer Cottages of the gilded age. All located on or off Belleview Avenue. 

    • Explore colonial Newport by taking a self-guided or guided walking tour through the streets of our gas-lit Historic Hill District. 

    • The famous Cliff Walk offers some of our most spectacular ocean views. Or take Laurence & John’s abridged 3.5-mile cliff walk from the Inn.

    • Visit the Newport Vineyards for some wine tasting.

    • A drive around the island on Ocean Drive is a must. Stop at the Castle Hill Lighthouse!

    • International Tennis Hall of Fame. A must see for the tennis enthusiast. 

    • The Touro Synagogue. America's Oldest Synagogue, dedicated in 1763. 

    • Newport National Golf Club. #1 Rated public access course in Rhode Island. 

    • 12 Meter Charters: Book a day sail on a classic America’s Cup Yacht.  

    • Fort Adams: The largest coastal fortification in the US dating back to the 1820s.   

     

    Abridged 3.5 Cliff Walk
